Pre-Game Insights: Suryakumar Yadav starts a new chapter in his cricketing career as captain of the Indian team in T20Is.
Gautham Gambhir takes over as Head Coach of the World Champions in T20s.
Sri Lanka will look to make amends for their dismal show in the recently concluded T20 World Cup, with Charith Asalanka leading the side’s revival.
Nuwan Thushara, unfortunately, has sustained a finger injury and is out of the series.
Dilshan Madushanka is brought into the mix for Sri Lanka.
Hardik Pandya is back against an opposition he loves.
An Indian team with a new captain and a new coach looking to chart their roadmap for the T20 World Cup 2026 to be held on home soil.
An exciting new journey ahead for Suryakumar Yadav and the team in the shortest format as they seek to continue the winning habit against the Lankans in the three-match series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Head-to-head records in T20Is: Sri Lanka - 9 wins, India - 19 wins.
Most Runs: Dasun Shanaka - 430 runs, Rohit Sharma - 411 runs.
Most Wickets: Dushmantha Chameera - 16 wickets, Yuzvendra Chahal - 23 wickets.
